label: HubSpot Marketing API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Hubspot Marketing API.

tools.name: AddCampaignBudgetItem
tools.description:
Add a new budget item to a marketing campaign.

Use this tool to add a budget item to an existing campaign in HubSpot Marketing. Ideal for updating campaign financials.

parameters.name: budget_amount
parameters.description: The monetary amount for the budget item. It should be a numeric value denoting the budget amount to add to the campaign.

parameters.name: budget_item_name
parameters.description: Name of the budget item to be added to the campaign. It should be descriptive and concise.

parameters.name: budget_item_order
parameters.description: The position or priority of the budget item in the list. Provide as an integer.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign in HubSpot Marketing.

parameters.name: budget_item_description
parameters.description: A brief description of the budget item being added to the campaign. This can include details about what the budget will be used for and any other relevant information.

budget_item_description.value: Funds allocated for social media ads targeting our new product launch.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ArchiveCampaignsBatch
tools.description:
Delete a batch of marketing campaigns.

Use this tool to delete multiple marketing campaigns in a single batch request (up to 50
campaigns). The response will indicate if the request was processed, but it won't specify the
success of individual deletions.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ArchiveMarketingForm
tools.description:
Archive a marketing form in HubSpot.

Use this tool to archive a form in HubSpot Marketing, preventing new submissions. The form will be permanently deleted after 3 months.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The ID of the form to archive in HubSpot. This is required to process the archive request.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AssociateAssetWithCampaign
tools.description:
Associate a specified asset with a HubSpot campaign.

This tool is used to link various asset types such as forms, lists, or emails with a specific HubSpot campaign. It's useful for managing and organizing marketing efforts across different platforms.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the asset to be associated with a campaign. This should be provided as a string.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Specify the asset type to associate with the campaign. Allowed values are FORM, OBJECT_LIST, and EXTERNAL_WEB_URL.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID. Essential for associating an asset with the correct campaign.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AssociateListWithMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Associate a list with a marketing event by their IDs.

This tool associates a specific list with a marketing event using the marketing event ID and the list ID. It is used when you need to connect a list of contacts to a marketing event for tracking and management purposes.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list to associate with the marketing event.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot for association.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CancelMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Cancel a HubSpot marketing event.

Use this tool to mark a specific HubSpot marketing event as cancelled by providing the external event ID.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application. Required to identify the event to be cancelled.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CloneHubspotEmail
tools.description:
Clone an existing HubSpot marketing email.

Use this tool to create a copy of an existing email in HubSpot's marketing platform. Ideal for reusing email templates and maintaining consistency in marketing campaigns.

parameters.name: original_email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the email you wish to clone in HubSpot.

parameters.name: cloned_email_name
parameters.description: The new name for the cloned email. This should be a descriptive string to identify the copy.

parameters.name: email_language
parameters.description: Specify the language for the cloned email, e.g., 'en' for English, 'fr' for French.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateAbTestEmailVariation
tools.description:
Create a new variation for an email A/B test.

Use this tool to generate a new variation of an existing email for conducting A/B tests in your marketing campaigns. This is useful for testing different email content to optimize engagement and performance.

parameters.name: email_content_id
parameters.description: ID of the email content to create a variation for A/B testing.

parameters.name: variation_name
parameters.description: The name of the new email variation for the A/B test. Provide a descriptive name to easily identify this variation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateCampaignSpend
tools.description:
Create a new campaign spend item for a marketing campaign.

This tool creates a new spend item for a specified marketing campaign. It should be called when you need to add or track expenditures related to a specific campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the marketing campaign to add the spend item to.

parameters.name: spend_amount
parameters.description: The monetary value of the spend item to be added to the campaign. This should be a numerical value representing the amount in the currency used by the campaign.

parameters.name: spend_item_name
parameters.description: The name of the spend item to be created for the campaign. This should be a descriptive title or label for the expenditure.

parameters.name: spend_item_order
parameters.description: The order of the spend item in the campaign. Use an integer to specify the sequence.

parameters.name: spend_description
parameters.description: A brief description of the campaign spend item, detailing the nature or purpose of the expenditure.

spend_description.value: Expenditure for Facebook and Instagram advertising.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateMarketingCampaign
tools.description:
Create a marketing campaign and retrieve its details.

This tool creates a marketing campaign using provided properties and returns the campaign
object, including essential details like campaignGuid and created properties.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateMarketingCampaignBatch
tools.description:
Create a batch of marketing campaigns in HubSpot.

This tool is used to batch create up to 50 marketing campaigns in HubSpot Marketing. The
campaigns in the response may not be in the same order as they were submitted in the request.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"campaigns":[{"name":"Spring Sale","description":"Promote our spring collection.","start_date":"2023-03-01T00:00:00Z","end_date":"2023-03-31T23:59:59Z"},{"name":"Summer Fest","description":"Annual summer sale event.","start_date":"2023-06-01T00:00:00Z","end_date":"2023-06-30T23:59:59Z"},{"name":"Fall Discounts","description":"Discounted prices for fall products.","start_date":"2023-09-01T00:00:00Z","end_date":"2023-09-30T23:59:59Z"}]}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateMarketingEmail
tools.description:
Create a new marketing email in HubSpot.

Use this tool to create a new marketing email through HubSpot's marketing platform, allowing for
effective email campaigns.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value:
{"subject":"Spring Sale Announcement","fromEmail":"promotions@example.com","toEmails":["customer1@example.com", "customer2@example.com"],"htmlContent":"

Don't miss our Spring Sale!

Get up to 50% off on selected items.

","sendAt":"2023-10-01T10:00:00Z"}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Create a new marketing event in HubSpot.

This tool is used to create a new marketing event within the HubSpot platform. It should be
called when a new event needs to be added to HubSpot's marketing event system.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"event_name":"Fall Webinar","event_date":"2023-09-15T14:00:00Z","location":"Online","description":"An informative webinar about autumn trends in marketing.","capacity":100}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateMarketingForm
tools.description:
Create a new marketing form in HubSpot.

This tool is used to add a new form to HubSpot's marketing systems. It should be called whenever
you need to create a new form for collecting marketing data.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateSmtpApiToken
tools.description:
Creates a SMTP API token for transaction emails.

This tool is used to create a new SMTP API token for sending transactional emails through HubSpot's marketing service. It should be called when a new token is needed for email operations.

parameters.name: campaign_name
parameters.description: The name of the campaign associated with the SMTP API token.

parameters.name: create_contact_for_recipients
parameters.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients. Set to true to create a contact.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteCampaignBudgetItem
tools.description:
Delete a specific campaign budget item by ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific budget item from a campaign using the campaignGuid and budgetId. Useful for managing or updating campaign budgets.

parameters.name: budget_item_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the budget item to be deleted.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign to delete the budget item from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMarketingCampaign
tools.description:
Delete a specified marketing campaign.

Use this tool to delete a marketing campaign from the system by providing the campaign's GUID. A 204 No Content response is returned, indicating the request was processed, regardless of whether the campaign existed.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMarketingEmail
tools.description:
Delete an existing marketing email by ID.

Use this tool to remove a specific marketing email from the HubSpot system by providing its unique email ID. This is useful for managing email lists and ensuring outdated or incorrect emails are removed.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the marketing email to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Deletes a specified HubSpot marketing event.

Use this tool to delete an existing marketing event in HubSpot by specifying the externalEventId. The event must have been created by the same app requesting the deletion.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event to be deleted in the external event application.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application to be deleted.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMarketingEvents
tools.description:
Delete multiple marketing events by object ID.

This tool deletes specified marketing events based on their object IDs. Use it to clean up
events from the portal. It returns a status indicating whether all or only some events were
successfully deleted.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteSmtpToken
tools.description:
Delete an SMTP token by ID in HubSpot Marketing.

Use this tool to delete a specific SMTP token from HubSpot Marketing by providing the token ID.
This is useful for managing and revoking access tokens when they are no longer needed or for
security reasons.

parameters.name: smtp_token_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the SMTP token to be deleted, provided during token creation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DisassociateCampaignAsset
tools.description:
Disassociate an asset from a HubSpot marketing campaign.

Use this tool to remove a specified asset from a marketing campaign. Supported asset types include Forms, Static lists, and External website pages.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the asset to be disassociated from the campaign.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of asset to disassociate, limited to FORM, OBJECT_LIST, or EXTERNAL_WEB_URL.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DisassociateListFromMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Disassociate a list from a marketing event using event and list IDs.

Use this tool to remove the association between a specific list and a marketing event by providing the marketing event ID and the list ID. It ensures that the list is no longer linked to the specified marketing event.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list to be disassociated from the marketing event.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot to disassociate the list from.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DisassociateMarketingEventList
tools.description:
Disassociate a list from a HubSpot marketing event using IDs.

Use this tool to disassociate a list from a specific marketing event in HubSpot by providing the external account ID, external event ID, and list ID. This action is useful when you need to update or manage your marketing event associations.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID linked to the marketing event in the external application.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list to be disassociated from the marketing event.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: ID of the marketing event in the external application to be disassociated.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchCampaignContactIds
tools.description:
Fetch contact IDs for a specific campaign and contact type.

Use this tool to obtain the contact IDs associated with a particular marketing campaign and specified contact type in HubSpot. It is useful for analyzing campaign reach and engagement with specific contact demographics.

parameters.name: campaign_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: contact_type_filter
parameters.description: Specifies the type of metric for filtering contacts. Options: contactFirstTouch, contactLastTouch, influencedContacts.

parameters.name: contact_fetch_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of contact IDs to retrieve, with a default of 100.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string cursor for pagination to start results after the given point. Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

parameters.name: report_end_date
parameters.description: The end date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to the current date if not specified.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Default is 2006-01-01.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchEmailStatistics
tools.description:
Fetch aggregated email statistics in specified intervals.

This tool retrieves aggregated email statistics over specified time intervals, providing insights into email performance during each period.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchEventDetails
tools.description:
Fetch details of a marketing event by its object ID.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about a specific marketing event by providing its object ID. This can be useful for gaining insights into the event's specifics and managing marketing activities.

parameters.name: marketing_event_object_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot. Used to fetch specific event details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchMarketingCampaignBatches
tools.description:
Retrieve a batch of HubSpot marketing campaigns and assets.

    Use this tool to read a batch of marketing campaigns from HubSpot, along with their associated
    assets. The tool allows for processing up to 50 campaigns per request. Note that the campaigns
    returned may not be in the order requested, and duplicate campaign IDs will be handled by
    returning only unique entries.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: fetch_start_date
parameters.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Determines the period for asset metrics. Optional.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: requested_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to return in the response. Ignored if values are empty, resulting in an empty properties map if not specified.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FindHubspotMarketingEvents
tools.description:
Fetch HubSpot marketing events by externalEventId.

Use this tool to retrieve marketing events from HubSpot where the externalEventId matches the given request parameter. It only returns events created by the app making the request, excluding those made by other apps.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external application (externalEventId) to search for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetAllMarketingEvents
tools.description:
Retrieve all marketing events from the portal.

This tool fetches all available marketing events, including manually created ones and those generated through the application. The events are sorted by objectId.

parameters.name: cursor_position_after
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: response_limit
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of marketing events to retrieve, between 10 and 100.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignAttributionMetrics
tools.description:
Retrieve attribution metrics for a specific campaign.

Retrieves key attribution metrics for a specified campaign, including sessions, new contacts, and influenced contacts. Use this tool to analyze campaign performance.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID. Required to retrieve specific campaign metrics.

parameters.name: report_end_date
parameters.description: Set the end date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to the current date if not specified.

parameters.name: start_date_for_report
parameters.description: The start date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Default is 2006-01-01.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignBudget
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific marketing campaign budget item.

This tool is used to obtain information about a specific budget item within a marketing campaign by providing the campaign GUID and budget ID. Use this tool to access detailed budget data for analysis or reporting purposes.

parameters.name: budget_item_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the budget item to retrieve details.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the marketing campaign to access its budget details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignBudgetDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed budget and spend details for a campaign.

This tool retrieves detailed information regarding the budget and spending for a specific marketing campaign, including total budget, total spend, and remaining budget. It's useful for understanding financial aspects of a campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details and metrics for a specific marketing campaign.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a marketing campaign using its campaignGuid. It also provides information about associated assets, and if start and end dates are given, metrics for those assets.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. If omitted, no metrics will be retrieved.

parameters.name: metrics_start_date
parameters.description: Start date for fetching asset metrics. Format as YYYY-MM-DD. Metrics are only retrieved if both start and end dates are provided.

parameters.name: properties_list
parameters.description: List specific properties to return in the response. Leave empty for an empty properties map.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignRevenueReport
tools.description:
Fetch revenue attribution report for a specific campaign.

This tool retrieves the revenue attribution report data for a specified marketing campaign using its unique campaign GUID.

parameters.name: campaign_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: attribution_model
parameters.description: The revenue attribution model to be used. Allowed values: LINEAR, FIRST_INTERACTION, LAST_INTERACTION, FULL_PATH, U_SHAPED, W_SHAPED, TIME_DECAY, J_SHAPED, INVERSE_J_SHAPED. Defaults to LINEAR.

parameters.name: report_end_date
parameters.description: End date for the report data in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: report_start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the report data in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Default is 2006-01-01.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetCampaignSpendItem
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific campaign spend item.

Use this tool to get information about a campaign spend item by providing its spendId and campaignGuid.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the marketing campaign to retrieve the spend item from.

parameters.name: spend_item_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the spend item in the campaign.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetContactParticipationsBreakdown
tools.description:
Retrieve a contact's event participation details by ID or email.

This tool retrieves participation details for a specific contact in marketing events using their email or internal ID. It is useful for analyzing a contact's engagement in various events.

parameters.name: contact_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the contact, which can be either an email or an internal ID.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for the last retrieved item to manage pagination.

parameters.name: participation_state
parameters.description: The participation state for the contact. Options: REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW.

parameters.name: response_size_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of participation records to return. The default is 10, and the maximum is 100.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEmailAbTestVariation
tools.description:
Retrieve the variation of an A/B test marketing email.

Use this tool to get the opposite variation of a specified A/B marketing email. Ideal for determining the alternative version presented in a marketing email campaign.

parameters.name: email_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to obtain its A/B test variation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEmailRevisions
tools.description:
Retrieve all versions of a marketing email.

Use this tool to get a comprehensive list of all versions of a specified marketing email, each containing the full state of that version.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to retrieve revisions for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEmailStatistics
tools.description:
Get aggregated email statistics in a specified time span.

Use this tool to obtain aggregated statistics for emails sent within a specific time period. It also provides a list of all emails sent during that period.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEventParticipationCounters
tools.description:
Retrieve participation counters for a specific marketing event.

This tool fetches participation metrics for a marketing event using the externalAccountId and externalEventId. It should be called when you need detailed participation statistics for a specific event in HubSpot's marketing platform.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the marketing event in the external application. Required to retrieve participation data.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event in the external application.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFormById
tools.description:
Retrieve a marketing form by its ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific marketing form by providing its unique form ID.

parameters.name: form_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific marketing form to retrieve. This ID is required to fetch the form details.

parameters.name: return_archived_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only archived forms.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingCampaigns
tools.description:
Retrieve a page of marketing campaigns with optional filters.

This tool allows retrieval of a page of marketing campaigns based on query parameters such as name filtering, sorting, and pagination. You can also control the properties included in the response.

parameters.name: campaign_name_filter
parameters.description: A substring to filter campaigns by name. Returns campaigns containing this substring. Optional: returns all if not provided.

parameters.name: max_results_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of campaigns to return (1-100). Default is 50.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. If provided, results start after the given cursor. Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

parameters.name: requested_properties
parameters.description: A list of properties to be included in the response. Comma-separate values are required. If any specified property is empty, it will be ignored.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Specify the field to sort results by. Use '-' to denote descending order. Options are hs_name, createdAt, updatedAt. Default is hs_name.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEmailDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details for a specific marketing email.

Use this tool to get comprehensive information about a marketing email by specifying its email ID.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific marketing email. Required to retrieve email details.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEmailRevision
tools.description:
Retrieve a specific revision of a marketing email.

Use this tool to get details about a specific revision of a marketing email by providing the email and revision IDs.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the marketing email. This ID is required to specify which email's revision details to retrieve.

parameters.name: email_revision_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the specific email revision to retrieve. Provide the revisionId for accessing the exact version.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventAssociatedLists
tools.description:
Retrieve lists associated with a specific marketing event.

Call this tool to get lists associated with a marketing event using external account and event IDs. Useful for accessing participant or attendee lists linked to specific marketing events.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event in the external application.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event from the external event application.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific marketing event.

Fetches details of a marketing event using its externalEventId. Only events created by the requesting app can be accessed.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The accountId associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing event in the external application.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventLists
tools.description:
Retrieve lists associated with a specific marketing event.

This tool fetches all lists associated with a given marketing event using the marketing event ID. It should be called when you need to obtain lists connected to a particular marketing event for analysis or reporting purposes.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot to retrieve associated lists.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventParticipationBreakdown
tools.description:
Retrieve the participation breakdown for a marketing event.

This tool fetches the participation breakdown for a specified marketing event, filtered by externalAccountId and externalEventId. It provides detailed insights on event participation metrics.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The ID associated with the marketing event's account in the external application.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: contact_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the contact, such as an email or internal ID.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item, used for pagination.

parameters.name: participation_state_filter
parameters.description: The participation state to filter results. Possible values: REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW.

parameters.name: response_size_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of participations to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 100.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventParticipationCounters
tools.description:
Retrieve participation counters for a marketing event.

This tool fetches the participation statistics for a specified marketing event using its internal identifier.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot, required to fetch participation counters.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMarketingEventParticipationsBreakdown
tools.description:
Retrieve participations breakdown for a specific marketing event.

This tool fetches a detailed breakdown of participations for a specific marketing event identified by marketingEventId. It can be used to analyze participation metrics and insights for a given event.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

parameters.name: contact_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Contact. It can be an email or internal ID.

parameters.name: last_retrieved_position_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item for pagination.

parameters.name: participation_state
parameters.description: The participation state filter, which can be REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, or NO_SHOW.

parameters.name: response_size_limit
parameters.description: Set the maximum number of records to return. Default is 10, maximum is 100.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSmtpTokenById
tools.description:
Retrieve details of an SMTP token using its ID.

This tool is used to query a specific SMTP token by its ID within the HubSpot Marketing platform.
Call this tool when you need to access detailed information about a particular SMTP transactional token.

parameters.name: smtp_token_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the SMTP token to be queried.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: HubspotMarketingEmailFilter
tools.description:
Retrieve and filter HubSpot marketing emails.

Use this tool to retrieve and filter marketing emails from HubSpot. It allows you to apply various filters to find specific sets of emails based on your criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: LinkListToEvent
tools.description:
Associates a marketing list with an event in HubSpot.

This tool associates a list with a marketing event using the external account ID, external event ID, and ILS list ID. It should be called when you need to link a specific list to a marketing event for tracking or organizational purposes.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application. Used to specify which event to associate with the list.

parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list to associate with the marketing event.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListCampaignAssets
tools.description:
Retrieve all assets of a specified type for a campaign.

This tool lists all assets of a particular type within a specified marketing campaign. It can also fetch asset metrics if start and end dates are provided, allowing for detailed analysis of campaign performance.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: The type of asset to fetch for the campaign, e.g., 'email', 'webpage'.

parameters.name: campaign_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign in UUID format.

parameters.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Used for fetching metrics of assets within a specified period. Optional parameter.

parameters.name: maximum_results_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of asset results to return. Default is 10.

parameters.name: metrics_start_date
parameters.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Used to fetch metrics for a specified period. If not provided, no metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. If provided, results start after this cursor. Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListHubspotForms
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of HubSpot marketing forms.

Call this tool to obtain a list of marketing forms from HubSpot. It applies search filters if provided, otherwise returns the first 20 forms by default.

parameters.name: included_form_types
parameters.description: List of form types to include in results, e.g., 'hubspot', 'workflow', etc.

parameters.name: paging_cursor_token
parameters.description: The token indicating the cursor position for paginated results. Use `paging.next.after` from the previous response to fetch more results.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of forms to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: return_only_archived_forms
parameters.description: Set to true to return only archived forms in the results.

tools.name: MarkMarketingEventCompleted
tools.description:
Mark a marketing event as completed in HubSpot.

Use this tool to mark a marketing event as completed in HubSpot, identified by its externalEventId. This confirms that the specified event has been finalized.

parameters.name: event_end_datetime
parameters.description: The date and time when the marketing event ended. Expected in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: event_start_date_time
parameters.description: The start date and time of the marketing event, formatted as an ISO 8601 string.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with the marketing event in the external application.

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the marketing event in the external event application.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ModifyEventInformation
tools.description:
Update details of a specific marketing event.

    Use this tool to update the details of an existing marketing event by providing the object's ID.
    It confirms whether the update was successful.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: event_internal_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name":"Updated Event Name","date":"2023-10-15","location":"Updated Location","description":"Updated description for the marketing event."}

tools.name: PublishHubspotEmail

Publish a HubSpot marketing email.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the HubSpot marketing email to publish.

tools.name: QuerySmtpTokens
tools.description:
Retrieve SMTP API tokens by campaign name or emailCampaignId.

Use this tool to query multiple SMTP API tokens associated with a campaign by its name, or to retrieve a single token using an emailCampaignId. This is useful for managing email campaigns and accessing specific token information.

parameters.name: campaign_name
parameters.description: Name of the campaign tied to the SMTP API token to query tokens.

parameters.name: email_campaign_id
parameters.description: Identifier assigned to the campaign provided during the token creation. Used to retrieve a specific SMTP API token.

parameters.name: maximum_tokens_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of SMTP API tokens to return in the response.

parameters.name: result_pagination_start
parameters.description: Specify a starting point for retrieving the next set of results. Use this for paginating through results.

tools.name: RecordEventAttendance
tools.description:
Record participation of HubSpot contacts in a marketing event.

    Use this tool to record the attendance of multiple HubSpot contacts at a marketing event using
    their HubSpot contact IDs. This also adds a timeline event to each contact's record. The tool is
    applicable for the "attend" state with optional properties like "joinedAt" and "leftAt".

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: marketing_event_id
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot for which attendance is being recorded.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: attendance_state
parameters.description: Specifies the attendance state of the contact: 'register', 'attend', or 'cancel'.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: RecordEventParticipationHubspot
tools.description:
Record participation of contacts in a HubSpot marketing event.

    Use this tool to record the attendance of HubSpot contacts in a marketing event using their
    email addresses. It can automatically create contacts if they do not exist and adds a timeline
    event for them. This is particularly useful for logging who attended or participated in specific
    marketing events.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external event application.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: subscriber_state
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for HubSpot contacts in the specified event. Options: 'register', 'attend', 'cancel'.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID linked to the marketing event in the external event application.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

Record participation of HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event.

tools.name: ResetEmailDraftToLive

Reset an email draft to match the live version.

Use this tool to reset an email draft to a copy of its currently live version in HubSpot Marketing. This is useful when you want to discard changes made to a draft and revert to the original published version.

parameters.description: The unique string identifier for the token, used to reset its password.

tools.name: RestoreEmailRevision
tools.description:
Restore a previous revision of a marketing email.

Use this tool to revert a marketing email to a specified previous revision. The current version is archived, and the restored revision is assigned a new version number.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the marketing email you want to restore. This ID is required to specify which email's revision needs restoration.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific revision of the email to be restored.

tools.name: RestoreEmailRevisionToDraft
tools.description:
Restore a previous email revision to draft state.

Use this tool to revert a marketing email back to a previous revision, setting it to DRAFT. This will overwrite any current content in the draft for that email.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email whose revision is to be restored to draft. This should match the specific email ID format used by HubSpot.

parameters.name: revision_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the email revision to be restored to draft state.

tools.name: RetrieveEmailDraft
tools.description:
Retrieve the draft version of a specified email.

This tool retrieves the draft version of a specified email by its ID from HubSpot Marketing. If no draft exists, the published version is returned instead. It should be used when you need to access the current draft or latest version of an email.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the email to retrieve the draft for. This ID is used to specify which email's draft or published version should be accessed.

- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"email":"example@example.com","subject":"Welcome to Our Service!","body":"Thank you for signing up!","recipient":"user@example.com"}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UnpublishMarketingEmail
tools.description:
Unpublish a HubSpot marketing email.

This tool is used to unpublish a specific email in HubSpot Marketing. It should be called when you want to deactivate or withdraw an email from being publicly available.

parameters.name: email_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the email you wish to unpublish in HubSpot Marketing.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateCampaignBatch
tools.description:
Update a batch of marketing campaigns efficiently.

Use this tool to update multiple marketing campaigns in a single request. The tool handles up to
50 campaigns per request, and can reset property values when an empty string is provided.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateCampaignBudget
tools.description:
Update a specific campaign budget item by ID.

Use this tool to update a particular budget item in a marketing campaign by providing the campaign GUID and the budget ID.

parameters.name: budget_amount
parameters.description: The amount to set for the budget item. This is a numerical value representing the budget in the specified currency.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the budget item to be updated.

parameters.name: budget_item_name
parameters.description: The new name for the budget item. It should be a descriptive label that clearly identifies the budget item within the campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the campaign. Use this to specify which campaign's budget item to update.

parameters.name: priority_order
parameters.description: Specify the order in which the budget item appears. Accepted values are integers.

parameters.name: budget_item_description
parameters.description: A string to describe the budget item. Provide a brief explanation of what this budget is for.

budget_item_description.value: Budget allocated for Q4 digital advertising.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateCampaignProperties
tools.description:
Update properties of a HubSpot marketing campaign.

    Use this tool to perform a partial update of a marketing campaign in HubSpot by providing the
    campaignGuid and the new property values. Note that only existing, mutable properties can be
    updated; read-only and non-existent properties will cause an error. Passing an empty string will
    reset a property's value.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: campaign_uuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateCampaignSpend
tools.description:
Update a specific campaign spend item by ID.

Use this tool to modify the details of a particular spend item in a marketing campaign by providing the campaign and spend identifiers.

parameters.name: campaign_guid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign.

parameters.name: spend_amount
parameters.description: The new amount value for the campaign spend. Specify this as a number representing the monetary value.

parameters.name: spend_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the spend item in the campaign to be updated.

parameters.name: spend_item_name
parameters.description: The new name for the campaign spend item. This should be a descriptive string defining the spend item.

parameters.name: spend_order
parameters.description: The order or sequence number of the spend item within the campaign. It determines the priority or arrangement of the spend items.

parameters.name: spend_item_description
parameters.description: Details or notes about the campaign spend item.

spend_item_description.value: Budget allocated for social media advertising.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateEmailDraft
tools.description:
Create or update the draft version of a marketing email.

    This tool creates or updates the draft version of a marketing email. If no draft exists, it
    creates a draft from the current live email and applies changes. Use this tool to modify email
    drafts before finalizing them.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing email to update or create a draft for. This is required to specify which email draft you are modifying.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"subject":"New Offer Available!","content":"Check out our amazing new offers that you won't want to miss!","recipients":["example@example.com"]}

tools.description:

Update components of a HubSpot marketing form.

Change properties of a marketing email.

tools.name: UpdateMarketingEventDetails
tools.description:
Update details of an existing marketing event.

    Use this tool to update the details of an existing marketing event identified by its external
    event ID. It is applicable only for events created by the same app.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The account ID associated with this marketing event in the external event application.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the marketing event in the external event application.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

This tool updates multiple marketing events in the HubSpot portal based on their objectId, if
they exist. It should be called when you need to batch update event details efficiently.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

tools.name: UpsertMarketingEvent
tools.description:
Upsert a marketing event in HubSpot.

    Upserts a marketing event using the provided external event ID. If an event with that ID exists,
    it updates the event; otherwise, it creates a new one.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path
    parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: external_event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the marketing event in the external application. Used to upsert the event in HubSpot.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name":"New Product Launch","date":"2023-10-15T10:00:00Z","location":"Online","description":"Launch event for new product line."}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpsertMarketingEvents
tools.description:
Upsert multiple marketing events in HubSpot.

Upserts multiple marketing events. Updates existing events with the same ID or creates new ones
if they don't exist. Only events created by the same app can be updated.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"events":[{"id":"event_001","name":"Launch Campaign","date":"2023-10-01","details":"Details about the launch campaign."},{"id":"event_002","name":"Webinar","date":"2023-10-10","details":"Details about the webinar."}]}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

documentationChunks.content: The HubspotMarketingApi MCP Server uses the Auth Provider with id `arcade-hubspot` to connect to users' HubspotMarketingApi accounts. In order to use the MCP Server, you will need to configure the `arcade-hubspot` auth provider.

summary:
This documentation describes the HubspotMarketingApi toolkit, which allows LLMs to directly interact with the HubSpot Marketing API to manage and analyze marketing campaigns effectively. 

**Capabilities**
- Create, update, and delete marketing campaigns, forms, emails, and events.
- Manage budget items associated with campaigns.
- Record and analyze event participation and contact interactions.
- Retrieve detailed metrics and statistics for marketing activities.

**OAuth**
- Provider: Unknown
- Scopes: content, crm.objects.marketing_events.read, crm.objects.marketing_events.write, forms, marketing-email, marketing.campaigns.read, marketing.campaigns.revenue.read, marketing.campaigns.write, transactional-email.
